name: Doppler Effect
explanation: Doppler effect is the change in frequency when source and observer move relative to each other. Moving toward each other: frequency increases (blue shift). Moving apart: frequency decreases (red shift). Used in radar, medical ultrasound, astronomy (measuring star speeds), and understanding wave behavior. Explains why sirens sound different when approaching vs. receding.

examples.problem: Ambulance (500 Hz) approaches at 30 m/s. Observer stationary. What frequency? (v_sound = 343 m/s)
steps: f' = f × v/(v - v_s) (source moving toward observer)
f' = f × v/(v + v_s) (source moving away)
